job.title: Software Engineer
job.description:
Have you ever wanted to build the fastest computer systems in the world? These days supercomputers are called "High Performance Computing Clusters" and they require ultra-high-speed networking hardware and software. Cornelis Networks' mission is to deliver innovative purpose-built interconnect solutions that enable our customers to optimally apply vast computational resources to create those clusters and solve the world’s toughest problems.
Cornelis Networks is hiring talented software development engineer to help implement the APIs that applications will need to use these clusters. The bulk of the work will be focused around the interfacing our hardware to different open-source standard APIs such as Open MPI, and GPU software standards such as CUDA, and NCCL.
Host Software Responsibilities
Responsible for maintaining and developing new features for both in-house and open-source APIs that allow customers to write applications for with use the Omni-Path fabrics
Analyze and develop technology solutions based on customer requirements
Build and implement host software products to meet business demands
Work with Developers and Architects in developing host software configurations based on requirements.
Identify and apply innovative technologies to update existing host software
Create and maintain documentation for host software installations, changes and upgrades
Train Junior Engineers on host software updates and new installations
Coordinate with vendors and support team on problem resolution, design issues and upgrades
Perform troubleshooting, incident response, and patching in a timely manner
Troubleshoot and resolve technical problems in timely and accurate manner to improve application performance and functionality
Evaluate system architecture and make recommendations as required
Develop and implement standard processes for installation, maintenance and enhancement of host software applications
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s, Master’s, or Ph.D. degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related discipline, or the equivalent in training and experience
Experience with networking software in the Linux kernel and extensive experience in C coding.
Understanding of network protocols, TCP/IP, scalable algorithms and virtualization. Software development tools and scripting in a Linux environment, including git source control
Preferred Qualifications
Development Bit Accurate and Transaction Accurate Modeling: experience in C++/SystemC
Experience in one or more scripting language (TCL, Python, Perl, Shell-scripting)
Experience with:
InfiniBand or another HPC interconnect
developing and supporting open-source projects
Open Fabrics Enterprise Distribution and upper-layer protocols such as IPoIB, SRP etc
kernel file system software including Lustre, NFS
WireShark and network traffic analysis
Excellent communication skills
Preferred Location
Cornelis Networks prefers key staff to be located at its Wayne, PA headquarters, but fully supports remote employees who are able to travel to our offices (when safe) periodically for in-person collaboration.
Cornelis Networks is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.
